The most common types in this chapter include
- Tension (or cervicogenic) headaches are caused by tightness of the musculoskeletal system of the cervical spine, particularly in the neck .

- Low-back pain may cause referred pain to the head caused by nerves originating in the lower spine, a condition referred to as cervicogenically mediated headaches .
